intro: Elatostema sessile var. polycephalum, commonly known as the clustered prostrate elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tiny greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. This variant is notable for its compact growth form and adaptability to humid, tropical conditions.
